item.title: Solid Principles
item.description: Solid Principles Single Responsibility Principle (SRP) The Single Responsibility Principle (SRP) is one of the five SOLID principles of object-oriented design and programming. It states that a class, module, or function should have only one reason to change, meaning it should have only one responsibility or job. This principle promotes the idea that a class should only have one reason to exist, encapsulating all the functionality related to that responsibility.
